body:
spack generates modules with /usr/bin in them. When this modules are loaded they switch compilers.

here is the list of modules I got.
```
$ cd /soft/spack-0.10.1/share/spack/lmod/linux-centos7-x86_64/
[ssergien@beboplogin1 linux-centos7-x86_64]$ grep -R "/usr/bin" *
gcc/7.1.0/m4/1.4.16-epqs64j.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/autoconf/2.69-obpbcpi.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/bison/2.7-mjao2rh.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/flex/2.5.37-6pkw7dj.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/cmake/2.8.12.2-mh5v6sj.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/automake/1.13.4-kokvbmh.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/openssl/1.0.1e-nn3ng5d.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/libtool/2.4.2-lyjk4te.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
gcc/7.1.0/pkg-config/0.27.1-lyjdbtd.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/bison/2.7-ifeqg3x.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/openssl/1.0.1e-afp44aa.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/libtool/2.4.2-zrj7kuz.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/libtool/2.4.2-xzrrrf5.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/pkg-config/0.27.1-azeappb.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.3/pkg-config/0.27.1-or5h6mu.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/m4/1.4.16-4mceggk.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/autoconf/2.69-potli3m.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/bison/2.7-m5h6nq4.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/flex/2.5.37-mdp4grx.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/automake/1.13.4-a2fyvjt.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/openssl/1.0.1e-cdz677p.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/libtool/2.4.2-f5ckt6h.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
intel/17.0.4/pkg-config/0.27.1-tkab33h.lua:prepend_path("PATH", "/usr/bin")
```
That is probably coming from this inside of packages.yaml:
```
autoconf:
    paths:
      autoconf@2.69 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      autoconf@2.63 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
  automake:
    paths:
      automake@1.13.4 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      automake@1.11.1 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
  bison:
    paths:
      bison@2.7   arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      bison@2.4.1 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
  cmake:
    paths:
      cmake@2.8.12.2 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
  flex:
    paths:
      flex@2.5.37 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      flex@2.5.35 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
  libtool:
    paths:
      libtool@2.4.2 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      libtool@2.2.6b arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
  m4:
    paths:
      m4@1.4.16 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64: /usr
      m4@1.4.13 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64: /usr
    buildable: False
```
```$ spack find -p m4
==> 6 installed packages.
-- linux-centos6-x86_64 / gcc@6.1.0 -----------------------------
    m4@1.4.13  /usr

-- linux-centos6-x86_64 / intel@17.0.0 --------------------------
    m4@1.4.13  /usr

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.8.5 -----------------------------
    m4@1.4.16  /usr

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@7.1.0 -----------------------------
    m4@1.4.16  /usr

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / intel@17.0.4 --------------------------
    m4@1.4.16  /usr
    m4@1.4.18  /blues/gpfs/home/software/spack-0.10.1/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/intel-17.0.4/m4-1.4.18-vytvqhc2wpwfxvqnjisv6z5pd756nenw
```
I think this modules should not be generated. 

Or at least do `append_path` vs `prepend_path` 

Thanks
title: spack generates modules with /usr/bin
